channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11399] Improve Quickstart chapter and move Pseudo-distributed and distributed to it
item.summary: Improve Quickstart chapter and move Pseudo-distributed and distributed to it

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Big rewrite of Quickstart chapter and part of Configuration chapter. Configuration chapter will definitely need more work but that can be in a different JIRA I think. I will upload a PDF as well for easier review.

I looked at the first 3 pages thus far (more to come). you probably need to check spacing throughout the document.

Page 1:
0.98.3+ a makes standalone mode durable so we should change the warning. see [1][2] This would be similar to the subsequent loopback warning.

Page 2:
paragraph starting with 4. Need a space before jps. and after HMaster.

under section 5. Need space before cf:a.

page 3:
section 9. The drop will fail because if in step 8 you re-enabled the table.

section 10. space after quit.

page 3.
section 1.2.3 / hadoop configuration. need space before the http link.

[1] https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-11272
[2] https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-11218

Here's the rest of the review.

High level do we want to get rid of some colloquialisms?
"north of" ,"chicken-little comment"

page 5.
example 1.3/1.4/1.5 if you have hbase kick off zookeeer, you will see a HQuorumPeer process. If you kicked off zk on your own, they would be QuorumPeer. The hbase HQuorumPeer I believe is hard coded to kick off a single zk node – useful for testing but not for production workloads.

page 6.
bullet #4. Shouldn't the ports be 16xxx for trunk and 0.98 and 60xxx for 0.94? the docs say 6xxxx

page 6.
"use rsync". maybe we should be a little more general here? use scp, rsync or you favorite mechanism for pushing files...

page 7.
section 2.1.2.5 mac os -> MacOS (or some other capitalization that is consistent)

page 10.
section 2.2.3 Change to be "Typically, production HBase clusters are run in ...." so that we differentiate the "standalone is default".
Just FYI, those spacing issues don't exist in the source. Not sure if there was a problem with how I created the PDF. Addressing the other ones now.

Also I am testing with 0.98.3 and it uses 60xxx. I did see that the docs claim otherwise for 0.98 so I'm not sure what is going on there. For instance my cluster is up at http://my-ip:60010/master-status and reports:

HBase Version 0.98.3-hadoop2, rd5e65a9144e315bb0a964e7730871af32f5018d5

BTW, Apple refers to their operating system as "OS X" with no Mac. It's important to refer to trademarks in the way their holders prefer if possible so I will create a separate JIRA to align the way we refer to OS X.

Also, some of your feedback, especially the second lot, is for things that I didn't get to edit yet. I'll do a more thorough update of that chapter today.

Fixed errors and issues brought up in feedback, expanded the scope of the edits to the prerequisites section of the Configuration chapter, up to the Hadoop section. I stopped editing before the Hadoop support matrix, because I don't want the scope of this JIRA to creep too much. Standby for a fresh PDF which will hopefully not have the odd formatting issues of the first one.
This PDF should not have the spacing issues but is not styled at all, and is just provided as a quick review tool if you don't want to build the docs locally.

good stuff.

bullet #4. Shouldn't the ports be 16xxx for trunk and 0.98 and 60xxx for 0.94? the docs say 6xxxx

Also I am testing with 0.98.3 and it uses 60xxx. I did see that the docs claim otherwise for 0.98 so I'm not sure what is going on there. For instance my cluster is up at http://my-ip:60010/master-status and reports:

The bug in section 1.2.4, procedure 1.7, bullet 4 is subtle. Double check the ports – it says 6010 and 6030 instead of either 16010 or 60010, or 16030 or 60030.

let's fix that and then I'll commit.
Sorry about missing that. This patch fixes the port errors.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12653243/HBASE-11399-2.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12653243

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 11 new or modified tests.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 3 warning messages.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 13 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ xlink:href="http://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/Running_Hadoop_On_OS_X_10.5_64-bit_%28Single-Node_Cluster%29">SSH:
+ xlink:href="http://www.cloudera.com/blog/2009/03/configuration-parameters-what-can-you-just-ignore/">Configuration
+ the <filename>/etc/pam.d/common-session</filename> file contains the following line:</para>
+ environment. This provides support for Linux/Unix commands and scripts. The full details are explained in the <link
+ xlink:href="http://www.alexjf.net/blog/distributed-systems/hadoop-yarn-installation-definitive-guide">http://www.alexjf.net/blog/distributed-systems/hadoop-yarn-installation-definitive-guide</link>.</para>
+ are used unless the value is overridden in the <filename>hbase-site.xml</filename>. See <xref
+ xlink:href="https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-11218">HBASE-11218</link>.</emphasis></para>
+ and some other distributions default to 127.0.1.1 and this will cause problems for you . See <link
+ download the binary file that ends in <filename>.tar.gz</filename> to your local filesystem. Be
+ <systemitem>testuser</systemitem>. Paste the <markup><property></markup> tags beneath the

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestActiveMasterManager

-1 core zombie tests. There are 1 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TestIOFencing.testFencingAroundCompactionAfterWALSync(TestIOFencing.java:218)

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9901//testReport/
